projectPurpose: To provide a comprehensive, safe, and secure suite of tools and libraries for interacting with the Domain Name System (DNS), specifically a DNS client, server, and resolver, built using the Rust programming language.
mainFeatures: DNS client, server, and resolver components
DNS over TLS (DoT), DNS over HTTPS (DoH), DNS over QUIC (DoQ)
Written in Rust for memory safety and security

alternatives.name: PowerDNS
alternatives.license: Open Source (GPLv2, Apache 2.0, MIT depending on component) and Commercial

marketPositioning: Hickory DNS positions itself as a modern, safe, and secure alternative to established DNS implementations, leveraging the memory safety and performance characteristics of the Rust programming language. It provides a comprehensive suite of tools and libraries for building various DNS applications, from basic clients to complex servers and resolvers, with a strong emphasis on security through features like DNSSEC and support for encrypted DNS protocols (DoT, DoH, DoQ). While competing with widely adopted solutions like BIND, Unbound, and PowerDNS, its Rust foundation and focus on memory safety offer a distinct advantage for developers and organizations prioritizing these aspects.
